div.p: Has anyone had to use the help desk?
What resources do you use as far as the technology basically?
For me, I just used the Help Desk initially when I started here,
as far as setting up all of my accounts.
They were very helpful in that regard.
I actually enjoyed working with Angel.
Especially for the online classes, being able to converse with everyone through Angel.
I've had professors that have actually videoed themselves, in class and online classes,
and supplemented the PowerPoints so that way you could go back
and actually view your class you had attended in case you had any issues or your online classes
where they would put audio to the presentations.

You would sit for an hour or so throughout
the week at your convenience and just go
through your class for the week and then you'd have your discussion board.
So they're really taking advantage of the technology that's out there today.
Because of the decrease in amount of tuition ACCESS students pay, you don't have access
to all the services that the traditional students do.
But we do provide tutoring.
I don't know if any of you have used it or taken advantage of it,
if you could talk a little bit about that.
I used tutoring yesterday.
I have used tutoring.
Like you said, solely because of the difference in tuition, there's a little bit of a difference
in the access the ACCESS students have.
Fortunately, I go by day and I have other situations that facilitate
and offer me the opportunity to use the tutoring services.
I have to say though that I've had all professional tutors, they're excellent,
Besides that, sometimes I think that because we don't have access
to certain services, we don't stop and ask questions.
I have to say the staff, even if you're not necessarily entitled to those services,
will stop and answer questions for you.
And they say, "Hey, I can't really tutor you, but what is it you're working on?"
That is really important in that department.
However, you do have to be proactive on your own behalf.
Seek that out.
Because they can't read your mind.
They can't always know what your needs are-you don't really come with a sign or anything.
So, I have had occasions when, even though the person wasn't my tutor, I'd say,
"Can you read this and tell me if I had it right?"
And I'd go correct it and turn it in.
The tutoring service is really excellent there.
That's good advice.
How about the library.
Do people use the library these days?
I live in the library!
I love the library.
It's just a great place.
The atmosphere there.
Everything.
The people there are great.
The resources are phenomenal.
I love the library.
If I'm a returning student and I haven't written a paper for 25 years, could I go to someone
in the library, and would they take time to help me?
Absolutely.
That's what they do.
I think there are signs on the door telling you that.
I think there are signs on the counter when you go in.
They want to help.
They want to help.
They really do.
They're great over there.
